name: clodhopping
content:
clodhopping adjective [before noun]
(person)
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to refer to someone who moves in an awkward way: You clodhopping idiot! That clodhopping decorator has spilt a tin of paint all over the floor.
More examplesFewer examplesOne of her brother's clodhopping guests knocked the television over.Rugby's once clodhopping no-hopers have transformed themselves into potential champions.He has a rather clodhopping style of running.

clodhopping adjective [before noun]
(shoes)
used to describe shoes that are heavy in a way that is not very attractive: big, clodhopping shoes I didn't want to tread on her bare feet in my clodhopping work boots.
More examplesFewer examplesEven if they used force they would never get those clodhopping shoes on me.She was wearing hideous clodhopping boots with a clumpy heel.Trying to get those clodhopping boots on put me off skiing for life.
